alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Central and South Weld County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 14 at 2:21AM MDT until October 14 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE NORTHEAST PLAINS... Breezy northwest winds will continue today as low pressure remains to the east. Meanwhile, strengthening high pressure over and west of Colorado will lead to warmer and drier conditions. The resulting combination will produce critical fire weather conditions during the afternoon hours, mainly for the northeast plains and in/near the Cheyenne Ridge and northern I-25 corridor. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE NORTHEASTERN COLORADO PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon today to 6 PM MDT this evening. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 243, 245 and 246. * Timing...Today from Noon to 6 PM. * Winds...Northwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 12 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid fire spread. Avoid any burning or outdoor activities that may produce a spark and start a wildfire.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
